name: Bahgali Polo
description: This is the number one, all-around favorite in my household. It literally translates to beans and rice, but it is, oh, so much more than that. See notes for vegetarian options. You can use other beans for this recipe, such as broad beans and fava beans. This also works well with chicken in place of the lamb.
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste
5 tablespoons dried dill weed, or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Thoroughly rinse rice and transfer to a large bowl. Pour enough water over the rice to cover by a few inches and soak for 1 hour; drain.
Bring a saucepan of water to a boil. Cook lima beans in boiling water until tender, 7 to 10 minutes; drain.
Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add salt and rice to the boiling water and cook until rice is partially softened, about 11 minutes; drain.
Season lamb with cinnamon, salt, and pepper.

Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir lamb in melted butter until completely browned, about 5 minutes. Use a slotted spoon to transfer lamb to a bowl. Cook and stir onion in skillet until translucent, about 7 minutes. Return lamb to skillet; add dill and cooked lima beans. Remove skillet from heat.

Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heat; add 1 tablespoon hot water. Spoon about 1/3 the partially cooked rice into the saucepan. Layer about half the lamb mixture over the rice layer. Repeat layering 1/2 the remaining rice, the remaining lamb mixture, and finishing with the remaining rice. Cut the remaining 3 tablespoons butter into cubes and arrange atop the top rice layer.

Place a cover on the saucepan, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook until the rice is completely tender, about 30 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat and let the mixture cool for 10 minutes before serving with yogurt.

review.reviewBody: Smelled and tasted delicious! I think some of the dill should be cooked in the rice not just in lamb/beans/onion mixture. Also I thought it should be 2 1/2 cups of rice not lbs so that s what I did. Otherwise followed recipe closely. It was good but better when mixed together rather than layered. I will make again.

I had frozen lima beans in the freezer for some time, so I searched for recipes with this ingredient.  Just reading through the ingredients, it sounded delicious even if there was only one review listed.  And I was not disappointed.  Even if I did not use lamb and used chicken instead, it tasted just lovely with that buttery goodness in the rice.  I followed the recipe almost exact, but because it was a meal for just me and my husband, I cut the ingredients in half.  My husband loved it.  I will definitely add this to the rotation and will try it with lamb for sure.  Make sure to not forget the yogurt, because in the end... this goes well with the whole dish.  Enjoy!
